item.description:
Windham Rail Trail - Salem, NH entrance

There is construction on Roulston Rd around the vet's place, follow the Detour signs which put you back on Roulston in less than 100 yards.

There is a large parking lot, but it is private. The tenants discourage parking there because of Insurance Liability reasons and have recently put up NO PARKING signs.

There is off street parking alongside the road.

Mitchell Pond is home to beavers & herons.

Paved Trail Picture

The Heron Nest Picture
item.how_to_find_us: We'll be parked across from the trail entrance - look for my Golden Retriever Hugo & the puppy mobile: green Volvo Station Wagon with NH eprint plates. Look for the Meetup Sign in the car.
item.why: The trail is paved and also has soft shoulders for the puppies' paws. There are 2 large bodies of water to be discovered where my Golden loves to cool off in. The water is fairly clean now because it is spring. The bugs are not too bad either.

group.name: Human Soles & Doggie Paws Hikers & Walkers of Manchester, NH

item.name: Windham Rail Trail - Salem Entrance
